raw_text:
Oscar nominee Dan O'Herlihy dies
 
 Irish actor Dan O'Herlihy, who was nominated for best actor at the 1955 Oscars, has died at the age of 85.
 
 O'Herlihy, whose Oscar nomination was for Luis Bunuel's The Adventures of Robinson Crusoe, died at his home in Malibu, California, a spokesman said. The actor began his film career in the 1940s, playing Macduff to Orson Welles' Macbeth in 1948, and was also a regular in on the Dublin stage. He later appeared in Robocop and its sequel and cult TV show Twin Peaks. He played the CEO of Omni Consumer Products in 1987's Robocop and Robocop 2 three years later, and was saw mill owner Andrew Packard in Twin Peaks, also in 1990. Despite his Oscar nomination, he had few other lead roles and became a familiar supporting actor on TV and in film. The year he was nominated, the Academy Award was won by Marlon Brando for On the Waterfront.

He began his career in the 1940s and appeared in films such as "Robocop" and "Twin Peaks." Despite the Oscar nomination, he had few lead roles but became a familiar supporting actor on TV and in film. In 1955, Marlon Brando won the Academy Award for On the Waterfront.
opencoder:1.5b: O’Herlihy, a British actor, who was nominated for the 1955 Oscars as a best actor, died at age 85. His Oscar nomination for The Adventures of Robinson Crusoe was also announced in 1962 and the film's director, director Robert Zemeckis, ended it with a Grammy Nomination.

Dan O'Herlihy, a prominent Oscar-winning actor who received the Best Actor nomination for *The Adventures of Robinson Crusoe*, passed away at 85 years old in Malibu, California. Known for his film Career starting in the 1940s and regular roles on Robocop and later Twin Peaks, he became synonymous with the show through his TV work.
tinyllama:1.1b: Irish actor Dan O'Herlihy, who gained fame for his Oscar-nominated performance as a lead actor in 1955 film Robinson Crusoe, has passed away at the age of 85. He had also appeared in several other notable films over the years, including roles in The Adventures of Robinson Crusoe and Luis Bunuel's Twinspeaks. Despite his nomination for a best actor award, O'Herlihy had few leading roles in film and television, becoming well-known primarily for supporting performances. His death came shortly before the 70th annual Academy Awards ceremony, where he would have been nominated again this year in the category of best actor.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Dan O'Herlihy, an Irish actor who made his mark with his role as Macbeth, passed away at the age of 85. He received an Oscar nomination in 1955 for his portrayal of the character, which also gave rise to a famous line – "There's none so blind, as those who will not see."

Despite his Oscar nomination, he had limited leading roles, with most appearances being in TV and film supporting parts. The Academy Award for Best Actor in 1955 went to Marlon Brando for On the Waterfront.
